plugins.name: ContentFlow
plugins.description:
ContentFlow is the ultimate text manager for Figma, designed to keep designs, copy, and teams perfectly aligned. Whether you want to gather and review edits before updating your designs or streamline developer handoff, this plugin simplifies every aspect of text management.


Here‚Äôs what you can expect:

  1. ‚è≥ Postpone Text Updates: Accumulate edits without immediately applying them‚Äîbatch updates or finalize them as needed.
  2. üîé Real-Time Change Detection: Automatically track every tweak in Figma, highlighting modified or removed text layers for quick review.
  3. üë• Collaborative Updates: Every team member with the plugin sees changes in the file, ensuring everyone stays on the same page.
  4. ‚è™ Complete Version History: Access a full log of edits anytime, and revert to previous versions in a click ‚Äî ideal for instant rollbacks or detailed audits.
  5. üè∑Ô∏è Easy Status Labeling: Use four statuses (Progress, Done, Rejected, Dev) to clearly show where each piece of text stands.
  6. üöÄ Developer Mode: Give developers a clean interface showing only finalized content, with one-click copying and preserved formatting.
  7. üåê Smart Organization: Search and filter text by status, date, or keywords, with items neatly grouped by frames for instant clarity.
  8. üé® Adaptive UI: Switch between light and dark themes, and toggle to a compact layout when you need to save screen space‚Äîalways keeping things clear and intuitive.


Keep your text workflow efficient, organized, and worry-free. ContentFlow ensures designers, writers, and developers stay perfectly synced with minimal fuss and maximum productivity!
plugins.tagline: A collaborative text manager to track updates, organize content, and streamline dev handoff.

plugins.name: Recent frames
plugins.description:
Work faster by quickly navigating back to the frames you recently worked on. The plugin displays a small window with a history of Figma frames you clicked. You can use the back button to quickly go to your last frames. Only top-level frames are listed; nested frames are ignored.


Features:

  1. Back button to quickly navigate to a previously selected frame.
  2. List of recent frames: a single click centers the frame in your view, while a double-click auto-fits the zoom.
  3. Light and dark mode with native Figma UI style.
  4. Menu with special actions: quickly jump to the selected node in your local main component or select the same child node in all component instances.


Why I Created It:

I built this plugin because I work on complex Figma prototypes. I often need to copy something from a distant frame and then jump back to where I was working. I sometimes forget where I was in the project. I wanted a simple way to undo and return to my previous spot without any hassle.


Use Cases:

  1. Effortlessly undo your navigation by returning to the last frame you clicked.
  2. Quickly jump between components and your working frames.
  3. Present your design flows without manual panning and zooming.
plugins.tagline: Instantly jump to your last frames with a back button

plugins.name: Figma to PowerFX theme converter
plugins.description:
Easily transform your Figma variables into reusable themes for Power Apps with our plugin. Figma to Power FX theme converter is a tool for Power Apps designers and developers who want to streamline their workflow and save time.


Key Features:

  1. Automated Conversion: All the variables in your Figma file are automatically translates into Power FX variables while maintaining the Figma hierarchy.
  2. Collection selection: Choose the collection you want to convert into Power FX.
  3. Color Format: Choose the color format you prefer to use between RGBA and Hexadecimal


We are continuously working on improving the plugin and plan to add new parameters for even more customization in future versions.
plugins.tagline: Convert your Figma variables into themes for use in your Power Apps

plugins.name: Flatten to Image
plugins.description:
This plugin flattens each selected layer into a single image. It can either replace the original layers or create a copy to the right. You can also select desired format, and resolution.

Works similar to "Copy as PNG" option, but you don't have to do it multiple times if you have a lot of layers, nor export them and import again.

plugins.name: Lighthouse
plugins.description:
Lighthouse helps designers check Lottie animation compatibility across iOS, Android, and Web. It scans Figma frames, detects unsupported features like shadows, blurs, etc., and lists issues directly on affected layers. Double-click to jump to problem layers and get instant updates as you fix them‚Äîensuring a smooth animation workflow.


How to Use Lighthouse:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Select a Frame ‚Äì Open Lighthouse and choose a frame to analyze.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Instant Issue Detection ‚Äì View a list of unsupported animation features.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Quick Fix Navigation ‚Äì Double-click an issue to select the affected layer.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Live Updates ‚Äì Changes update instantly as you fix issues.

5Ô∏è‚É£ Final Check & Export ‚Äì Ensure compatibility for seamless Lottie animations.

6Ô∏è‚É£ Mark frames ‚Äì Mark frames that are ready for animation to avoid confusion and ensure efficient workflow.


Simplify your motion design process with Lighthouse! üöÄ
plugins.tagline: Instantly detect unsupported Lottie features in Figma for seamless cross-platform animations.

plugins.name: Frameverse
plugins.description:
Frameverse - Share Frames Seamlessly


Frameverse is a powerful Figma plugin that revolutionizes design sharing. Generate secure tokens for your frames and assets, allowing instant access across teams and continents. Share specific design elements without exposing your entire file, maintaining control while enabling seamless collaboration.



‚ú® Key Features


- One-Click Sharing: Select any frame, section, or slice and generate a shareable token instantly

- Smart Import: Paste a token to import frames with perfect fidelity, maintaining all properties including:

- Layout structures and constraints

- Shapes and component instances

- Vector paths and effects

- Fonts and text styles

- Images and fills


- Batch Operations: Share or import multiple frames at once

- Preview Panel: Visual preview of selected frames before sharing



üéØ Perfect For


- Design System Teams sharing component updates

- Agencies sharing design patterns with clients

- Product Teams maintaining consistent layouts across files

- Anyone looking to transfer frames between files without manual recreation



üí° How It Works


1. Select the frames you want to share

2. Click "Generate Token" to create a unique share code

3. Share the token with your team

4. Recipients paste the token to import frames with all properties intact (Eg: YJS-hoo)



üîí Security & Performance


- Tokens are temporary and expire after 24 hours

- No data persistence - files are fully purged after token expiration

- Share specific frames without exposing entire files

- Intelligent compression and processing for optimal performance

- Progressive loading for larger frames



No account required. Start sharing frames in seconds!



Questions or feedback? Contact us
plugins.tagline: Exchange assets with the most intuitive frame sharing solution for Figma

plugins.name: Table flipper
plugins.description:
Hey :)

This plugin lets you flip the table's layout, from rows to column, or columns to rows.

If the table is an instance, it will detach it.


If you like it, please like and comment. It will help others to see the value as well :)


Watch demo.

Support my work here <3


How to use:

  1. Select a frame that contains only a table
  2. Select the flip direction


Important notes:

Make sure to select the right direction, otherwise it will not work properly, and make sure the table is well built:

  1. Same amount of cells in all columns
  2. Same amount of cells in all rows
  3. Same width to all cells in row/column

Otherwise it will not work properly. Super important to how the plugin works.


How it works behind the scenes:

I calculate how many cells the table has by:

  1. How many rows/columns
  2. How many cells the first row/column has (I assume all others have the same number of cells).
  3. I go in a loop and re-arrange the table ( rows/columns * cells times)


Enjoy :)


(Image source: https://www.flickr.com/photos/skkorea/13529912033)
plugins.tagline: Flip table's layout direction from rows to columns / columns to rows

plugins.name: DTÁªÑ‰ª∂Á≠õÈÄâ DT Component Selector
plugins.description:
Introduction:

The DT Component Selector plugin is a Figma tool designed to quickly filter and locate DT components in your design. This plugin helps designers improve their workflow by efficiently identifying and managing DT components in complex layouts.


Function Description:

  1. Filters all components in the selected frame that match the DT component criteria.
  2. Categorizes components into those visible on the canvas and those outside the visible bounds.
  3. Supports quick location of selected components for further manipulation.


How to Use:

  1. Select a frame and click the "Show Component Filter" button.
  2. The plugin will automatically filter the qualifying DT components, displaying the results as visible and non-visible components.
  3. Click the "Locate" button next to a component to quickly locate it in your design.


Notes:

  1. The plugin filters only DT components that match predefined criteria, ignoring other types.
  2. Make sure to select a frame for the plugin to function correctly.

‚Ä¢ ÏùºÍ¥ÑÏ†ÅÏúºÎ°ú ÌÖåÎëêÎ¶¨ ÎëêÍªòÎ•º ÏàòÏ†ï Ìï† Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§.

‚Ä¢ Ïª¥Ìè¨ÎÑåÌä∏ Î∞è Ïù∏Ïä§ÌÑ¥Ïä§ÏôÄ Ìï®Íªò ÏûëÎèôÌï©ÎãàÎã§.

‚Ä¢ ÌÖåÎëêÎ¶¨ ÎëêÍªòÎ•º Ïñ¥ÎñªÍ≤å Ï°∞Ï†ïÌï†ÏßÄÏóê ÎåÄÌï¥ ÏÑ∏ Í∞ÄÏßÄ ÏòµÏÖò Ï§ëÏóêÏÑú ÏÑ†ÌÉùÌï† Ïàò ÏûàÏäµÎãàÎã§.


Ïù¥ ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïù∏ÏùÄ ÏïÑÏßÅÎèÑ ÏûëÏóÖÏù¥ ÏßÑÌñâ Ï§ëÏù∏ ÌîÑÎ°úÏ†ùÌä∏ÏûÖÎãàÎã§. ÎåìÍ∏ÄÍ≥º ÌîºÎìúÎ∞±ÏùÄ ÌôòÏòÅÏûÖÎãàÎã§!


-------------


This plugin helps you batch change icon stroke sizes so that you can maintain consistency and don't have to do it manually. Helps in maintaining a clean design system.


  1. Check for stroke size consistency.
  2. Batch change stroke sizes.
  3. Works with components and instances.
  4. Chose from 3 options as to how you want to scale your stroke sizes.


This is a work in progress. Any comments and feedback would be appreciated.

plugins.name: TRANS-AI
plugins.description:
TRANS-AI helps designers create multilingual designs by translating text layers and automatically adjusting layouts for right-to-left languages.


Key Features:

  1. Translate selected text layers using OpenAI, Anthropic, or Gemini API (bring your own API key)
  2. One-click layout conversion between RTL and LTR designs
  3. Option to automatically adjust layouts when translating to/from RTL languages
  4. Exclude specific layers from translation using the layer name filter
  5. Preserves text formatting while converting layouts


Perfect for teams creating multilingual products, localizing interfaces, or working with global audiences. TRANS-AI streamlines the localization workflow, saving designers hours of manual adjustments when adapting designs for different languages.
plugins.tagline: Go global in seconds! AI-powered translation with smart RTL/LTR layout conversion.

plugins.name: Frame to JSON - AI-powered Design-to-Code Converter

A powerful Figma plugin that transforms your design frames into structured JSON data, ensuring seamless developer handoff and design-to-code consistency.


‚ú® Key Features

‚Ä¢AI-powered frame analysis

‚Ä¢One-click frame-to-JSON conversion

‚Ä¢Complete hierarchy and style preservation

‚Ä¢Customizable export options

‚Ä¢Developer-friendly structured output


üöÄ How to Use

1.Select your target frame(s) in Figma

2.Launch the Frame to JSON plugin

3.Review the extracted structure and properties

4.Click ‚ÄúGenerate JSON‚Äù

5.Copy or download the JSON output instantly


üõ†Ô∏è What You‚Äôll Need

‚Ä¢Figma design frames


üîí Security Note

Your data is processed securely, with no external storage. The plugin ensures precise design-to-code conversion while maintaining full control over your export preferences. No more manual adjustments‚Äîlet AI handle the complexity! ‚ú®

With the Consistify plugin, you can be be able to:


Detect Design Inconsistencies: Scan multiple frames for discrepancies in font styles, colors, buttons, iconography(coming soon), spacing, and navigation elements(coming soon) etc.


Get Visual Feedback: Receive clear, color-coded tags indicating inconsistencies, with direct frame references and numerical comparisons for easy analysis.


Streamline Workflow(coming soon): Highlight design issues directly in the UI, allowing users to click and focus on problematic frames, helping maintain design system integrity across projects.


To use the Consistify plugin, follow these steps:


Open your design in Figma.

Select at least 2 frames you want to compare for inconsistencies.

Run the Plugin


Advanced Features(coming son:


Accessibility Checker: Analyze contrast ratios in real-time for WCAG compliance.

Component Management: Identify duplicate components and track usage statistics.


Design System Health Monitoring: Flag inconsistent color usage, manual overrides on text styles, and mismatched font sizes.


The plugin is a must-have tool for ensuring cohesive, well-structured designs while saving time on manual checks.

plugins.name: MGS Composer - Exporter
plugins.description:
Export your Figma Design into a Microchip Graphics Composer Project

Streamline your design workflow with the MGS Composer Exporter. This plugin bridges the gap between Figma's design environment and MGS Composer, enabling you to create stunning user interfaces in Figma and transfer them to Composer for further development.


Features

Automatic Asset Generation: Composer generates assets automatically from the exported data, saving time and effort.

Preserved Design Hierarchy: Composer mirrors Figma's design tree as closely as possible, ensuring an accurate translation of your design.

Component Support: Assets generated from Figma Components are treated as a shared resource, saving memory on your target device.


Detailed Guide


How to Use:

  1. Install the Plugin: Add it to your Figma workspace.
  2. Run the Plugin: An export window will appear on the right side of Figma's interface.
  3. Select Page: Navigate to the page you want to export from and click Select Page.
  4. Mark Objects for Export: The export window will list top-level objects. These will be translated to Screens in Composer. Select objects by clicking on them or their children in the Figma design, which will automatically mark them in the export window.
  5. Set Export Options: After selecting objects, choose from two options:
  6. Flatten Group Components during export: Flattens groups into a single image in the exported data.
  7. Export all primitives as .svg assets: Exports vectors like rectangles, lines, and text as SVG assets.
  8. Generate Data: Click the Generate Data button. The export window will show a view of all exported objects and a corresponding JSON file. You can add custom properties to the objects here in the upper view.
  9. Export File: Click the Export button at the bottom of the window and select a location to save the file.
  10. Open MGS Composer: Launch Composer and create a new design or open an existing one with a screen size adequate for your Figma content.
  11. Import Project: In Composer, go to "File > Import" and select Figma Composer Project. Confirm the prompt that appears.
  12. Done: Composer will import the file and add new screens, assets, and widgets to your design.


Support & Feedback:

MGS User Guide

MGS Forum
plugins.tagline: Exports your Figma Design into a Microchip Graphics Composer Project.

plugins.name: SpeX - Design to Code by AI
plugins.description:
SpeX ‚Äì Design to Code by AI


Transform your Figma components into AI-readable specs for seamless design-to-code automation.


üîç What is SpeX?

SpeX bridges design and development by exporting structured specifications from Figma‚Äîenabling AI tools like Cursor and GitHub Copilot to generate accurate, production-grade UI code that aligns with your actual components.


üéØ Who It's For

  1. Design system teams scaling reusable components
  2. Developers using AI coding assistants
  3. Product teams aiming for consistent handoffs
  4. Organizations enforcing structured design workflows


üöÄ Key Capabilities


üìã AI-Ready Export

  1. Export to YAML/JSON with full style tokens
  2. Support nested components, variants, and instances
  3. Auto-detect and optimize SVG icons
  4. Generate component preview thumbnails


üîß Fine-Tuning Metadata

  1. Add codeComponent and codeFilePath
  2. Auto-fill metadata via pattern recognition
  3. Visual tree browser with search and bulk editing


üóÉ Component Record Management

  1. Full CRUD for structured records
  2. Sync from Notion, APIs, or JSON files
  3. Filterable views with fallback thumbnails
  4. Export component registry as JSON


ü§ñ Real-Time AI Integration

  1. WebSocket-based MCP bridge for tools like Cursor AI
  2. Real-time dashboard and analytics
  3. Serve specs, manifest, and previews on-demand
  4. Auto-reconnect and error resilience


üß≠ How It Works

  1. Select Components ‚Äì from your Figma file
  2. Fine-Tune ‚Äì add mappings to your codebase (optional)
  3. Export or Connect ‚Äì structured file export or live MCP server
  4. Generate Code ‚Äì AI tools use the specs to write code that aligns with your system


üìÅ Output Structure (Simplified)

export-[timestamp]/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ screen.yaml # Main screen specs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ manifest.yaml # File manifest
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ components/ # Component specs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ styles/ # Design token definitions
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ icons/ # SVG exports
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ previews/ # PNG previews


Example screen.yaml

# screen.yaml
screen:
id: "signup-screen-001"
name: "SignupForm"
type: "FRAME"

dimensions:
width: 375
height: 812

styleRefs:
fills:
- "@styles/fills#background-default"
typography:
- "@styles/typography#body-normal"

children:
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/TextField#username-field-001"
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/TextField#email-field-002"
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/TextField#password-field-003"
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/Button#signup-button-001"
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/TextLink#login-link-001"


This defines a form-based screen layout with multiple input fields, a button, and a link‚Äîreferencing reusable components in the design system.


üîó spex-mcp

Install the companion server to integrate with AI dev tools:

‚Üí spex-mcp on npm


üí° Why SpeX?


For Designers

  1. Reduce handoff friction
  2. Track design usage across implementations


For Developers

  1. Avoid guesswork, get exact specs
  2. Leverage AI tools with full context


For AI Tools

  1. Access structured, hierarchical data
  2. Align generated code with real-world components


SpeX is where design systems meet automation. Your components. Your rules. Real code.
plugins.tagline: Built on your real components, not generic templates.

plugins.name: Eggstractor
plugins.description:
Design-to-code, simplified


Eggstractor is a Figma plugin that exports designs as SCSS mixins, allowing developers to build components their way while keeping styling updates seamless. By separating structure from styling, Eggstractor ensures that design changes don‚Äôt disrupt component architecture. And with automated code generation for updates, dramatically speed up iteration and reduce development overhead.


Designers: Easily update component designs and push them directly to code‚Äîno developer implementation needed.


Developers: Maintain full control over component structure while receiving Figma-driven style updates as branched pull requests for review before merging.


For an end-to-end setup and demo, check out our Getting Started Guide.


How It Works

  1. Connect to your GitHub repo.
  2. Structure your coded components to use SCSS mixins.
  3. When designs change in Figma, run the plugin to generate updated SCSS mixins.
  4. Review, then click to create a pull request.
  5. A developer reviews and merges, and the changes are live.


Current Status

Eggstractor is actively in development. While not all CSS properties are supported yet, our roadmap includes full support for core CSS properties, followed by an open-source design system built to leverage Eggstractor.


Eggstractor is an open source project by Bitovi. Contributions are welcome! Get involved at github.com/bitovi/eggstractor.


Need some help?

Check out our Getting Started Guide.


Need more help?

Chat with us on Discord | Send GitHub feature requests | Email to support@bitovi.com


Need pros to help design & build your design system or app? That‚Äôs Bitovi!

plugins.name: Codex ‚Äî Repository-Aware Code Generator powered by AI
plugins.description:
Codex is an AI powered code generator that learns your existing repo. You can import your repository, and Codex will generate code in your used framework, using your styles and configurations. It works with any framework or language. No setup necessary ‚Äî just import with one click and go!


Features


Code just like you wrote it yourself

Codex will adapt its code generation to the conventions and code style used across your repo. It will read config files and use the same libraries and frameworks you use in your project.


Refine your export further

Need to use a specific component? Instruct Codex to change your code and get a refined result, without losing the context. You can also do this multiple times, until you‚Äôre 100% happy.


Learns your repository with a one-click-import

You don‚Äôt have to map your figma components to your design system. Codex automatically recognizes which components you have implemented or installed and will use those for generating code.


Generates code in any framework or language

Any language, library or framework you are using in your repo will be used by Codex to generate code from Figma.


Learns from your feedback

As you refine your exports, Codex will remember your feedback and apply it to future code generations.


FAQ


Who is it for?

Codex is targeted at professional front end developers to speed up their workflows.


Does my figma file need special preparation?

No, but it works much better if all frames use auto layout.


Which frameworks are supported?

Codex is framework-agnostic. This means it can generate code in any language, for any framework. However, popular frameworks like React and Vue work best, as LLMs have more training data on them.


Can I use it without a repository?

Currently, no. But you can create a repository and initialize it with an empty skeleton in the framework of your choice, then Codex will generate code for that framework.


Does it work with monorepos?

If there is only one frontend package in the repo, likely yes. Better monorepo support is on the roadmap.


Does it only work in dev mode/design mode?

Codex works in both figma modes.


Does it only work with Github?

Currently, yes. Other providers coming soon.


Pricing


Check our pricing page for information on plans.
plugins.tagline: The code generator that understands your repository

plugins.name: Silent Sweep
plugins.description:
Silent Sweep is your go-to Figma plugin for effortlessly managing concealed elements in your designs. This powerful tool scans your current page, revealing all hidden layers within each frame and artboard.

With its intuitive card-based interface, you can quickly identify and select hidden elements, streamlining your cleanup process.


Key Features:


  1. Instant Detection: Automatically finds all hidden layers on your current page.
  2. Organized View: Displays hidden layers grouped by their parent frames for easy navigation.
  3. Selective Cleanup: Choose which hidden layers to remove with simple checkboxes.
  4. Real-time Updates: Refreshes automatically when you switch pages or make changes.
  5. Efficient Workflow: Helps maintain clean, organized Figma files without tedious manual searching.


Whether you're polishing up a final design or inheriting a complex file, Silent Sweep helps you maintain a tidy workspace. Say goodbye to forgotten hidden layers and hello to cleaner, more manageable Figma projects. Simplify your design process and boost your productivity with Silent Sweep ‚Äì your personal cleanup assistant in Figma

plugins.name: Vertical Trim Cap Height Scanner
plugins.description:
This plugin makes it easy to find text that has had "Cap Height to baseline" vertical trim applied with the click of a button.

It's a useful tool to find and fix incorrectly applied text trims.


How to use:

  1. Click the button on the page you want to search.
  2. Click on trimmed text to select it and modify manually.
  3. Click the button again to confirm the text no longer appears in results.


Tips for fixes:

  1. Be careful when changing trim settings to "Standard" as it may cause layout shifts.
  2. Start by fixing text with the "Main component" tag first.

plugins.name: IconBridge ‚Äì Automated Icon Handoff from Figma to GitHub
plugins.description:
A powerful Figma plugin that automates icon exports, optimizes assets, and pushes them directly to GitHub‚Äîseamlessly integrating design and development. IconBridge eliminates manual file handling, ensuring every icon is correctly formatted, optimized, and instantly available for development.



‚ú® Key Features


  1. Optimized Icon Export ‚Äì Export icons directly from Figma with automatic light/dark version generation for multi-colored icons.
  2. Seamless GitHub Integration ‚Äì Push icons directly from Figma to GitHub, with automated organization and validation.
  3. Automated Pull Request Creation ‚Äì IconBridge commits and opens a GitHub PR automatically, streamlining the handoff process.
  4. Secure Repository Access ‚Äì Uses GitHub authentication to ensure private and controlled icon handoff.




üöÄ How to Use


Quick & Optimized Icon Export

  1. Select your icons in Figma.
  2. Click ‚ÄúExport Icons‚Äù on the home screen.
  3. IconBridge automatically optimizes each icon, ensuring clean, lightweight SVGs.
  4. Click ‚ÄúSave‚Äù to download optimized icons directly to your device.


Automated Handoff to GitHub

  1. Select your icons in Figma.
  2. Click ‚ÄúExport to GitHub‚Äù to begin the automation.
  3. IconBridge optimizes and validates each icon before uploading.
  4. Automatically organizes icons in the correct repository folder.
  5. Creates a pull request automatically, ready for developer review.




üõ†Ô∏è What You‚Äôll Need

  1. A Figma project with icons.
  2. A GitHub repository for automated exports.




üîí Secure & Seamless Workflow

IconBridge ensures a secure, efficient, and automated handoff process:


  1. Direct Figma-to-GitHub integration‚Äîno external storage needed.
  2. Authentication with GitHub to keep your repository secure.
  3. Fully automated workflow‚Äîeliminating manual exports, uploads, and PR creation.


üöÄ Forget tedious icon management‚Äîlet IconBridge automate everything from Figma to production!
